content: starting chain it makes a smaller hole these 6 single_crochet s are the start of the mouse s butt continue with row 2 without joining the tail needs to be bent towards you so the first single_crochet of row 2 will need to be behind the tail row 2 *increase in each single_crochet* repeat around 12 stitches row 3 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 1* repeat around 18 stitches row 4 *increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2 * repeat around 24 stitches row 5 - 6 single_crochet 24 24 stitches row 7 yo5 bobble stitch in next stitch single_crochet 3 yo5 bobble stitch in next stitch single_crochet 19 24 stitches make sure that each bobble stitch is pressed to the outside of the mouse row 7 alternate pattern no feet - single_crochet 24 24 stitches row 8 - 10 single_crochet 24 24 stitches row 11 *single_crochet 2 decrease* repeat around 18 stitches row 12-13 single_crochet 18 18 stitches over the next two row check where your front feet are as compared to the back feet also check the ear placement usually when this pattern is worked as is the ears should be in the middle on top of the mouses head while the 4 feet are sitting flat underneath if they are off just change the position of where the front feet or the ears start in this row you can do this by adding or subtracting a single_crochet at the beginning or end of the row etc criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-mouse row 14 single_crochet 10 this next stitch is the first ear in the front loop only single_crochet half_double_crochet 3dc half_double_crochet single_crochet increase in next single_crochet single_crochet 2 increase in next single_crochet complete the next ear in the front loop only single_crochet half_double_crochet 3dc half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet 2 20 stitches summary single_crochet 10 ear increase single_crochet 2 increase ear single_crochet 2 = 20 stitches with this next row you are completing both the front feet and skipping the back loop where the ears are we made increases on either side of the ears in the row before to make up for missing two stitches row 15 single_crochet 2 yo4 bobble stitch single_crochet 2 yo4 bobble stitch single_crochet 4 skip back loop single_crochet 6 skip back loop single_crochet 2 18 stitches row 15 alternate pattern no feet - single_crochet 18 18 stitches row 16 single_crochet 18 18 stitches row 17 *single_crochet 1 decrease* repeat around 12 stitches stuff start stuffing and shaping the body it is best to slightly overstuff near the head when you have sewed up the nose you will need to take a needle and push some of the stuffing down into it row 18 *decrease single_crochet 4* repeat around 10 stitches row 19 single_crochet 10 10 stitches eyes put your eyes in now row 20 *decrease single_crochet 3* repeat around 8 stitches add a bit more stuffing row 21 *decrease single_crochet 2* repeat around 6 stitches bind bind off and leave a small tail
